title.value: Active learning meets fractal decision boundaries: a cautionary tale from the Sitnikov three-body problem
title.justification: The paper's title is clearly stated at the top of the document.
title.quote: Active learning meets fractal decision boundaries: a cautionary tale from the Sitnikov three-body problem

extractions.description: The paper investigates the failure of active learning (AL) techniques in predicting the stability of the Sitnikov three-body problem, a simplified chaotic N-body problem in computational astronomy. The study highlights the challenges posed by the fractal nature of the classification problem's decision boundary and provides a cautionary note for astronomers using AL in similar contexts.

type.justification: The study involves training deep learning models, running numerical simulations, and analyzing their performance to detect stability in a chaotic system.
type.quote: We train different deep learning models with the goal of predicting the stability of Sitnikov’s problem from its initial conditions, with and without AL.
